This field must be filled in when working with virtual currency

SEND_MONEY.AMOUNT.HINT: Due to the nature of blockchain technology and the mechanism for including outputs in a transaction, after you send a payment the change amount will be blocked in your safe. As soon as the transaction reaches the recipient (once it has accumulated ten confirmations), the change amount will be unblocked automatically.

ALIAS.CREATE.TITLE: Assign alias to safe account
ALIAS.CREATE.UNIQUE_NAME.HINT: An alias is a shortened form of your account. An alias can only include Latin letters, numbers and characters "." and "-". It must start with "@".
ALIAS.CREATE.COMMENT.HINT: The comment will be visible to anyone who wants to make a payment to your alias. You can provide details about your business, contacts, or include any text. Comments can be edited later.
ALIAS.EDIT.COMMENT.HINT: This comment will be visible to anyone who sends a payment to your alias or account. You can enter any information here, whether it be about your business, work schedule, contact information, or any other information, or you can leave the field blank. Comments can be changed.
ALIAS.SAFE.TRANSFER_ADDRESS: The account to which the alias will be transferred

ALIAS.ERROR.MIN_LENGTH: The alias must be 6-25 characters longs

DEALS.CONTRACT_FULL_PRICE.HINT: The total value of the contract is the full amount the buyer must pay the seller for the product or service
DEALS.YOUR_PLEDGE.HINT: The amount from which your pledge will be made will be reserved in your safe (unavailable for payments) until the contract with the seller is complete. Due to the nature of blockchain technology and the mechanism for including outputs in a transaction, the reserved amount may be larger than your future pledge. However, once the transaction is complete your pledge will precisely match the amount you have indicated and the difference will be unlocked.
DEALS.WHAT_SAFE: Safe from which your pledge will be made
DEALS.PAID_SAFE: Safe from which your pledge was made
DEALS.ACTIONS.SENT_PAYMENT_RETURN_PLEDGE: Transfer payment and return pledge to seller

SETTINGS.CORE_LOGGING_LEVEL: Level of detail in log file
SETTINGS.MAST_PASS_OFF: No master password is in use
MASTER_PASS.TITLE: Set master password
MASTER_PASS.RECOMMENDATION: Using a master password is strongly recommended!
MASTER_PASS.RECOMMENDATION.HINT:
A master password allows you to block the application from being used by third-party observers, as well as auto-lock the application via timer.
The master password can be used to confirm payments when they are sent, thus protecting you against having payments sent without your consent.
The master password also allows you to open safes that were open the last time the program was shut down using only the master password instead of entering passwords for each safe individually.
This way you only have to enter one password rather than several.
Although the master password allows you to open previously-opened safes without entering a password for each safe, YOU STILL HAVE TO REMEMBER THE PASSWORDS TO EACH OF YOUR SAFES.
MASTER_PASS.NOT_USE_QUESTION: Are you sure you don't want to use a master password?
MASTER_PASS.RECOMMENDATION.CONTENT1: Blocking the application from third-party observers. Auto-locking the application via timer.
MASTER_PASS.RECOMMENDATION.CONTENT2: Confirming a payment when sending it helps to prevent unauthorized payments.
MASTER_PASS.RECOMMENDATION.CONTENT3: Opening recent safes from the previous session using only the master password*
MASTER_PASS.RECOMMENDATION.FOOTER1: * There is no need to enter the password to each safe individually. You should enter only one password instead of several ones.
MASTER_PASS.RECOMMENDATION.FOOTER2: However, YOU STILL NEED TO REMEMBER THE PASSWORDS TO EACH OF YOUR SAFES.

TEST_NETWORK.DESCRIPTION: Attention, the test network is under way! Do not enter into sales transactions during the testing period. All transactions will be canceled at the moment of launch of the working version of the network. The balance of your safes will return to the original state. Your activity on the network during the course of the tapping will help us debug its work. Thanks!
